whoIsItFor.question: Who is TheGroupFinder for?
whoIsItFor.answer: TheGroupFinder is built for teams and organizations who want to streamline their task management. Whether you're a startup, a growing company, or an established enterprise, TheGroupFinder provides the tools you need to keep your team organized and productive.

whatIsIt.question: What is TheGroupFinder?
whatIsIt.answer: TheGroupFinder is a modern, AI-powered task management platform. You can create tasks, organize projects, and manage your team's work through natural language. The AI assistant helps automate routine tasks and provides intelligent insights to boost productivity.

howAIWorks.question: How does the AI assistant work?
howAIWorks.answer: Simply communicate naturally with the AI. Say things like 'Create a task for fixing the login bug' or 'Show me all high-priority tasks assigned to John' and the AI handles it instantly. No complex forms or manual data entry - the AI understands context and automates your workflow.

whatFeatures.question: What key features does TheGroupFinder offer?
whatFeatures.answer: TheGroupFinder includes AI-powered task creation, intelligent task assignment, project organization, team collaboration tools, workflow automation, real-time updates, and comprehensive reporting. Everything your team needs to stay organized and ship faster.

needTeam.question: Can I use it for team collaboration?
needTeam.answer: Absolutely. TheGroupFinder is designed for team collaboration. Create your organization workspace, set up projects, invite team members, and start collaborating immediately. The platform supports role-based permissions and seamless team communication.

howToStart.question: How do I get started?
howToStart.answer: Sign up with your work email or Google account, create your organization workspace, and invite your team members. The AI assistant will guide you through creating your first project and tasks, making onboarding quick and straightforward.

dataSafety.question: Is my organization's data secure?
dataSafety.answer: Yes. TheGroupFinder uses enterprise-grade security with encrypted data storage and secure authentication. We follow industry best practices for data protection and compliance. Your team's data is always protected and private.

systemPrompt.languageInstruction: IMPORTANT: You MUST respond and think in English. All your responses, reasoning, and internal thoughts should be in English. When using tools and generating responses, use English for all text content.
systemPrompt.intro:
You are a helpful AI assistant for a project management system.
Your role is to help users manage their tasks, projects, and team members through natural conversation.
systemPrompt.rulesIntro: When creating an issue, you MUST collect ALL of these BEFORE calling the createIssue tool:
systemPrompt.ruleTitle: Title (required) - Must have a clear, descriptive title
systemPrompt.ruleStatus: Status/Workflow State (required) - Must be a valid workflow state name from the list above
systemPrompt.rulePriority: Priority level (required) - MUST ask the user explicitly: "What should be the priority level? (low, medium, high, urgent, or none)"
systemPrompt.ruleProject: Project (required) - MUST ask the user: "Which project should this issue be added to?" and show available projects
systemPrompt.criticalRule1: DO NOT call createIssue or createIssues tools if ANY required field is missing (title, status, priority, or project)
systemPrompt.criticalRule2: DO NOT guess, infer, or default values - ALWAYS ask the user explicitly
systemPrompt.criticalRule3: DO NOT default priority to "none" unless the user explicitly says "none"
systemPrompt.criticalRule4: DO NOT use a default workflow state - always ask the user what status they want
systemPrompt.criticalRule5: Ask ONE question at a time to avoid overwhelming the user
systemPrompt.criticalRule6: If the user says "create an issue" with only a title, respond with: "Sure! To create the issue, I need a few more details. First, what should be the priority level for this issue? (low, medium, high, urgent, or none)"
systemPrompt.listIssuesRule:
When user asks to see issues or lists tasks, ALWAYS call the listIssues tool WITHOUT a limit parameter to get ALL issues.
Display the results as a bullet list with clear formatting.
systemPrompt.minimalInfoRule: When user provides minimal information, ask ONE follow-up question at a time.
systemPrompt.useToolsRule: Always use the provided tools for actions.

createIssue.description: Create a single new issue. For creating multiple issues at once (2+), use createIssues instead. You can use workflow state names (like "Todo", "In Progress", "Done") and they will be automatically matched to IDs. Same for project names, assignee names, and label names. CRITICAL: Do NOT call this tool if ANY required information is missing (title, status/workflow state, priority, or project). Instead, ask the user ONE question at a time for the missing information. Do not default priority to "none" - always ask the user to specify a priority level explicitly. Always ask which project the issue should be added to if not provided. Always ask what status/workflow state the issue should be in if not provided.
createIssue.title: The title of the issue (REQUIRED)
createIssue.descriptionField: A detailed description of the issue
createIssue.projectId: The project ID, key, or name (e.g., "testing" or project name) this issue belongs to (REQUIRED). Do not call this tool with project missing - always ask the user to specify which project to add the issue to.
createIssue.workflowStateId: The workflow state ID or name (e.g., "Todo", "In Progress", "Done") (REQUIRED)
createIssue.assigneeId: The user ID or name (e.g., "kartik") to assign this issue to
createIssue.priority: The priority level (REQUIRED - must be one of: low, medium, high, urgent, or none). Do not call this tool with priority missing or defaulted to "none" - always ask the user to specify a priority first.
createIssue.labelIds: Array of label names or IDs (e.g., ["Bug", "Feature", "Documentation", "Enhancement"])

createIssue.validationError: I need the following information to create the issue: {missingFields}. Please provide {fieldCount} to proceed. {projectsInfo}
createIssue.workflowStateError: Could not resolve workflow state "{state}". Available states: {availableStates}. Please specify a valid status/state name.

createIssues.description: Create multiple issues at once. Accepts an array of issue objects. Each issue needs: title, status (workflow state), priority, and project. IMPORTANT: Do NOT call this tool if any issue is missing title, status, priority, or project - instead, ask the user for the missing information first. Use this when the user asks to create multiple issues (e.g., "create 10 issues", "create issues for tasks X, Y, Z").
